title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1276.1 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1276.1 - Definitions

State Regulations

As used herein, (a) Flammable liquids shall mean any liquid
which emits a flammable vapor at or below a temperature of 80 degrees

Fahrenheit, as determined by flash point from Tagliabue open cup tester, and
shall include any other combustible liquids currently used for aircraft
fuels. (b) Cargo tank shall mean any
tank used on a vehicle engaged in the transportation of flammable liquids
excluding any tank containing flammable liquids used solely for the propulsion
of the vehicle itself, or for the operation of auxiliary engines. (c) Tank vehicle shall mean any vehicle used
for the transportation of flammable liquids and the associated fueling or
defueling of aircraft, and includes both tank trucks and tank
semi-trailers. (d) Tank truck shall
mean any single self-propelled tank vehicles having a cargo tank mounted
thereon. (e) Tank semi-trailer shall
mean any vehicle without motive power, having a cargo tank mounted thereon or
as an integral part thereof, and so constructed that when drawn by a tractor by
means of a fifth-wheel connection some part of its load and weight rests upon
the towing vehicle. (f) Fuel
handling system shall mean the cargo tank, the entire system of cargo handling
pipe to and from the discharge pumps, the discharge pumps and hose lines, together with the sump drain connections. (g) Full-trailer shall mean any vehicle
without motive power, having cargo tank mounted thereon or as an integral part
thereof, and so constructed that when drawn by a tractor by means of a
fifth-wheel connection no part of its load or weight rests upon the towing
vehicle. (h) Bottom loading shall
mean the arrangement of product piping and valving so as to permit the filling
of the cargo tank through the compartment manifold piping and the internal
valves. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21

1276.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
